suffix.label: Includes all resources loaded by the page.

suffix.name: NonAdFrames.Aggregate.Total2
suffix.label: The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources except for those loaded in ad frames.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.PeakWindowedPercent2
suffix.label: The peak load over all 30 second windows while the page is unactivated of an ad creative. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems. This is measured whether the frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.TotalUsage2
suffix.label: The total load of an ad creative across the life of the page. This is measured in milliseconds and capped at 10 seconds. This is measured whether the frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: AdFrames.Aggregate.TotalUsage2
suffix.label: The total CPU usage across all ad frames on a page in its lifetime. This is measured in milliseconds. This is measured whether a frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: FullPage.PeakWindowedPercent2
suffix.label: The peak load over all 30 second windows during the lifetime of the page. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems. This is measured whether a frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: FullPage.TotalUsage2
suffix.label: The total load of the page across its lifetime. This is measured in milliseconds and capped at 10 minutes. This is measured whether a frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: NonAdFrames.Aggregate.PeakWindowedPercent2
suffix.label: The peak load over all 30 second windows during the lifetime of the page of all non-ad frame activity including that of the main frame. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems. This is measured whether a frame was in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: NonAdFrames.Aggregate.TotalUsage2
suffix.label: The total load of non-ad frames on page including the main frame across its lifetime. This is measured in milliseconds and capped at 10 minutes. This is measured whether a frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: CacheHeuristic
suffix.label: In this case the response satisfies the Cache heuristic.

suffix.name: CORSHeuristic
suffix.label: In this case the response satisfies the CORS heuristic.

suffix.name: HiddenWhileFlushing
suffix.label: Tab hidden while flushing FCP value.

suffix.name: SentRequest
suffix.label: The request was sent over the network.

suffix.name: Used
suffix.label: A cache entry was used without using the network.

suffix.name: CantConditionalize
suffix.label: A cached resource existed but no conditional request could be written.

suffix.name: NotCached
suffix.label: There was no pre-existing disk cache entry.

suffix.name: Updated
suffix.label: A cached resource existed and was updated over the network.

suffix.name: Validated
suffix.label: A cached resource existed and was validated over the network.

suffix.name: Cache
suffix.label: For requests served from the cache.

suffix.name: Net
suffix.label: For requests served from the network.

suffix.name: ZoomedIn
suffix.label: Zoomed in view: shorter range, more buckets.

suffix.name: ZoomedOut
suffix.label: Zoomed out view: longer time range, less buckets.

suffix.name: IPv6_probe_done
suffix.label: with IPv6 probed for and possibly disabled

suffix.name: IPv6_probe_skipped
suffix.label: with IPv6 not probed, and default OS settings used

suffix.name: HighDPI
suffix.label: In web pages where device scale factor is greater than or equal to 1.5.

suffix.name: LowDPI
suffix.label: In web pages where device scale factor is less than 1.5.

suffix.name: Change
suffix.label: The user is asked to change their password

suffix.name: ChangeAutomatically
suffix.label: The user is asked to let Chrome automatically change their password for the current site.

suffix.name: Checkup
suffix.label: The user is asked to visit the Password Checkup

suffix.name: CheckupAndChange
suffix.label: The user is asked to visit the Password Checkup and change their password

suffix.name: Browser
suffix.label: Cache shared databases whose access pattern is dictated by browser code.

suffix.name: Unified
suffix.label: Cache shared by both web and browser.

suffix.name: Web
suffix.label: whose access pattern is directly influenced by Web APIs, like Indexed DB, etc.

The difference are 1. *.ByLiveTabCount2.* include samples from prerendered pages and 2. PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint.ByLiveTabCount2.* record duration from activation start to first contentful paint for prerendered pages.

suffix.name: Navigation
suffix.label: Prediction trigged at start of navigation based on what was learned locally from previous navigations to the same origin.

suffix.name: Localhost.DbRequests
suffix.label: Requests made to localhost on a database server port.

suffix.name: Localhost.DevRequests
suffix.label: Requests made to localhost on a development server port.

suffix.name: Localhost.OtherRequests
suffix.label: Requests made to localhost on any port not otherwise monitored by the other local network request metrics.

suffix.name: Localhost.PrinterRequests
suffix.label: Requests made to localhost on a printer server port.

suffix.name: Localhost.WebRequests
suffix.label: Requests made to localhost on a web server port.

suffix.name: DifferentSubnetRequests
suffix.label: Requests made to local resources on a different subnet.

suffix.name: SameSubnetRequests
suffix.label: Requests made to local resources on the same reserved IP space as the page.

suffix.name: RouterRequests
suffix.label: Requests made to resources likely to be routers.

suffix.name: LocationAttached
suffix.label: This histogram is for when the location was successfully attached to the request.

suffix.name: LocationNotAttached
suffix.label: This histogram is for when the location was not attached to the request. A location may not be attached if it is too old or if the permissions do not allow it.

suffix.name: BatterySaving
suffix.label: This histogram is for location mode Battery Saving.

suffix.name: GpsOnly
suffix.label: This histogram is for location mode GPS Only.

suffix.name: HighAccuracy
suffix.label: This histogram is for location mode High Accuracy.

suffix.name: EnhancedUnweightedTree200

suffix.name: OtherMimeType
suffix.label: A MIME type that doesn't fall into either of the other two categories.

suffix.name: ProtectedMimeType
suffix.label: A MIME type we expect CORB to protect (i.e. JSON, HTML or XML).

suffix.name: PublicMimeType
suffix.label: A MIME type we consider public (i.e. javascript or an image type).

suffix.name: ChromeNotSystem
suffix.label: Chrome is not a system installed browser.

suffix.name: ChromeSystem
suffix.label: Chrome is a system installed browser.

suffix.name: OtherDefault
suffix.label: Another browser is the default browser.

suffix.name: ConfirmInfobarTypeBlockPopups
suffix.label: Recorded for Block Popups Confirm Messages.

suffix.name: ConfirmInfobarTypeRestore
suffix.label: Recorded for Restore Tabs Confirm Messages.

suffix.name: WithoutByteSet
suffix.label: The version of the Module Integrity Verifier that doesn't use a hash set to track relocations.

suffix.name: ExistingRenderer_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation reused an existing renderer process. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: NewRenderer_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation spawned a new renderer process. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: SessionRestored_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation caused by restoring a tab from a previous session (whether from a crash or a continued session) either spawning or reusing a renderer. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: SerializedDisplayStateSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of DisplayState in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem DisplayState in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedReferrerURLSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of referrer's URL in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem referrer's URL in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedRequestHeadersSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of HTTP request headers in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem headers in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedTitleSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of title in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem title in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedURLSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of URL in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem URL in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedVirtualURLSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of virtual URL in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem virtual URL in session history.

suffix.name: OnDSE
suffix.label: Recorded only for pages whose URL matches the URL of the search results page of the user's default search engine.

suffix.name: OnNonDSE
suffix.label: Recorded only for pages whose URL does not match the URL of the search results page of the user's default search engine.

suffix.name: First21
suffix.label: Only the first group of 21 packets in a connection via

suffix.name: Some21s
suffix.label: After the first 21, this records data for some groups of 21 consecutive sequence nmubers, arriving via.

suffix.name: First6
suffix.label: Only the first group of 6 packets in a connection via

suffix.name: Some6s
suffix.label: After the first 6, this records patterns for some groups of 6 consecutive sequence numbers, arriving via.

suffix.name: Ack
suffix.label: Only packets that were received by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: IsAnAck
suffix.label: Only packets that were probably solo ACK packets when received by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: IsNotAck
suffix.label: Only packets that were probably NOT solo ACK packets when received by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: Nack
suffix.label: Only packets that were missed by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: CONNECTION_BLUETOOTH
suffix.label: Bluetooth are tallied, but this may include connections to a mobile hotspot.

suffix.name: CONNECTION_ETHERNET
suffix.label: ethernet are tallied, but this may include connections to a WiFi bridge.

suffix.name: CONNECTION_NONE
suffix.label: NO(?) network are tallied (should be empty).

suffix.name: CONNECTION_WIFI
suffix.label: WiFi are tallied, but this may include connections to a mobile hotspot. Also check similar histograms that end in WIFI_802.11* for more details on some platforms.

suffix.name: CONNECTION_WIFI_ANCIENT
suffix.label: 802.11 that are no longer standard are tallied.

suffix.name: NonPacedPacket
suffix.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets were sent as rapidly as possible.

suffix.name: PacedPacket
suffix.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets are sent at equal intervals. The interval is selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test.

suffix.name: StartPacket
suffix.label: Packets are sent as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked, and no data is recorded in this histogram.

suffix.name: Sent21
suffix.label: This histogram shows the number of echo responses received from the first

suffix.name: Sent21.AckReceivedForNthPacket
suffix.label: Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received an ACK for that packet.

suffix.name: Sent21.GotAnAck
suffix.label: The histogram shows if we ever got an ACK for a packet in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.443
suffix.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 443.

suffix.name: Sent21.6121
suffix.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 6121.

suffix.name: 443.100B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 6121.100B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.500B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
suffix.label: The histogram shows the RTT for

suffix.name: Send6.SeriesAcked
suffix.label: Chrome sends 6 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are responded to, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketsSent
suffix.label: This histogram records how many packets (out of 21 attempted) were sent to the server via UDP.

suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: NATBind.Sent2
suffix.label: Two packets were sent spreading over a random period, to test if the NAT dropped the binding. Afterwords, an extra (short) packet was sent with renewed NAT binding to test whether the network that was used to deliver the first packet is still connected. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least ten packets were received in the StartPacket test.

suffix.name: NonPacedPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

suffix.name: PacedPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent at equal intervals, which were selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

suffix.name: StartPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible, just after the client successfully sent a UMA upload. Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google.

suffix.name: Bind.Failure
suffix.label: Only when the second packet never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) and the first and the extra (short) packets arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Bind.Success
suffix.label: Only when all three packets including the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Connectivity.Failure
suffix.label: Only when the extra (short) packet (with renewed NAT binding) never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Connectivity.Success
suffix.label: Only when the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: SendToLastRecvDelay
suffix.label: This histogram records the time duration (in milliseconds) between the client sending the request and the receiving of the second packet sent from the server, excluding the idle time between sendings of the first two packets. Results are only shown if the first two packets are both received.

suffix.name: First6.SeriesRecv
suffix.label: This histogram records a bit vector of the first 6 packets sent, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are received, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

suffix.name: Sent21
suffix.label: This histogram shows the number of packets received from the first

suffix.name: Sent21.GotAPacket
suffix.label: The histogram shows if we ever got at least one packet in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketDelay
suffix.label: The histogram shows the average inter-arrival time between every two consecutive packets we receive in our series of 21 multiplied by 20 (so this is essentially the time duration between the first and the last received packets).

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketsRecv
suffix.label: The histogram shows how many packets we receive in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.RecvNthPacket
suffix.label: Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received that packet.

suffix.name: Sent21.SendToLastRecvDelay
suffix.label: This histogram records the time duration between the client sending the request and the receiving of the last packet sent from the server, excluding the total pacing time requested by the client. Results are only shown if at least two packets are received.

suffix.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
suffix.label: The histogram shows the RTT for the

suffix.name: NTP.ThirdParty
suffix.label: The NTP served by a third party (e.g. Bing)

suffix.name: BypassedDRP
suffix.label: Bytes of traffic that bypassed the Data Reduction Proxy

suffix.name: Direct
suffix.label: Bytes of traffic that were ineligible for the Data Reduction Proxy

suffix.name: Other
suffix.label: Bytes of traffic that don't fit into the other categories of Net.HttpContentLength

suffix.name: ViaDRP
suffix.label: Bytes of traffic that passed through the Data Reduction Proxy

suffix.name: Error
suffix.label: Connection to proxy resulted in an error

suffix.name: DiskCache
suffix.label: DiskCache backend is using disk cache.

suffix.name: MemoryCache
suffix.label: DiskCache backend is using memory cache.

suffix.name: WaitForDataReady
suffix.label: Tracks the last failure reason until WaitForDataReady or its callback is executed. This is recorded when data is ready in WaitForDataReady or when the callback is executed

suffix.name: Failure
suffix.label: Failed to fetch data from background service

suffix.name: Failure
suffix.label: Failed to fetch middle-slot Promo data

suffix.name: SuccessWithoutPromo
suffix.label: Successfully fetched middle-slot Promo data which did not contain a promo

suffix.name: SuccessWithPromo
suffix.label: Successfully fetched middle-slot Promo data which contained a promo

suffix.name: IconsColor
suffix.label: Icons using a fallback color (favicon resolution too low).

suffix.name: IconsGray
suffix.label: Icons using a gray color (no favicon available).

suffix.name: IconsReal
suffix.label: Icons using an actual icon published by the site.

suffix.name: Thumbnail
suffix.label: Not an icon but a thumbnail/screenshot of the page.

suffix.name: ThumbnailFailed
suffix.label: Default gray box in place of a thumbnail/screenshot.

suffix.name: drive
suffix.label: Module ID for Google Drive module

suffix.name: dummy
suffix.label: Module ID for a dummy module

suffix.name: dummy2
suffix.label: Module ID for another dummy module

suffix.name: photos
suffix.label: Module ID for Google Photos module

suffix.name: popular
suffix.label: Deprecated with M-62! Non-personalized, popular suggestions.

suffix.name: popular_fetched
suffix.label: Non-personalized, popular suggestions (fetched from the server).

suffix.name: NewTab
suffix.label: NTP loaded on a new tab.

suffix.name: Active
suffix.label: For a tab active which is shown foreground in a browser window.

suffix.name: Closed
suffix.label: For a tab that is about to be closed.

suffix.name: Detached
suffix.label: For a tab that is being dragged by user to outside of the browser window.

suffix.name: Inactive
suffix.label: For tabs in background and not shown to user.

suffix.name: Negative
suffix.label: Estimate of the metric was lower than observed metric

suffix.name: Positive
suffix.label: Estimate of the metric was higher than observed metric
Recorded approximately 15 seconds after navigation start

suffix.name: Broadband
suffix.label: Observed effective connection type was Broadband

suffix.name: Offline
suffix.label: Observed effective connection type was Offline

suffix.name: Slow2G
suffix.label: Observed effective connection type was Slow2G

suffix.name: Unknown
suffix.label: Observed effective connection type was Unknown
Observed metric was between 0 and 20 (inclusive) units
Observed metric was between 20 and 60 (inclusive) units
Observed metric was between 60 and 140 (inclusive) units
Observed metric was between 140 and 300 (inclusive) units
Observed metric was between 300 and 620 (inclusive) units
Observed metric was between 620 and 1260 (inclusive) units
Observed metric was between 1260 and 2540 (inclusive) units
Observed metric was between 2540 and 51000 (inclusive) units

suffix.name: 5100_Infinity
suffix.label: Observed metric was greater than 5100 (inclusive) units

suffix.name: ntp_suggestions
suffix.label: NTP suggestions offlined by the user

suffix.name: Failed
suffix.label: For items that failed being prefetched for any reason.

suffix.name: Successful
suffix.label: For items that were completed sucessfully.

suffix.name: FirstChange
suffix.label: First setting change since the user has focused the page (may include gaps of under one minute during which the page is not focused).

suffix.name: SubsequentChange
suffix.label: Subsequent setting changeafter the user has already changed a setting on the page.

suffix.name: OutOfRaster
suffix.label: Task was not performed as part of a raster task.

suffix.name: Background
suffix.label: The page was backgrounded at least once from navigation start to this event.

suffix.name: AfterPaint
suffix.label: Limited to the duration of time starting after first paint, for page loads that reached first paint.

suffix.name: AtTimingCallbackDispatch
suffix.label: Evaluated at the time timing update calls are dispatched to observers.

suffix.name: Clients.DataReductionProxy
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation through the data reduction proxy.

suffix.name: Clients.Previews.LitePages
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation through the data reduction proxy where a lite page response was received.

suffix.name: NonProxied
suffix.label: Resources not loaded through data reduction proxy.

suffix.name: PercentProxied
suffix.label: Percent of resources loaded through data reduction proxy.

suffix.name: Proxied
suffix.label: Resources loaded through data reduction proxy.

suffix.name: Clients.DocWrite.Block
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics from a page that has synchronous, cross-origin document.written scripts that could be blocked if the document.write script blocking feature is enabled.

suffix.name: Clients.FromGoogleSearch
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation from a Google web search

histogram_suffixes.name: PageLoadMetricsClientsLoadingPredictor
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: These suffixes are used to record metrics if LoadingPredictor enabled. As part of crbug.com/1317494, this suffix is replaced by Clients.LoadingPredictor2. The difference are 1. *.Clients.LoadingPredictor2.* include samples from prerendered pages and 2. the value of the UMAs are modified as activation origined for prerendered pages.

suffix.name: Clients.LoadingPredictor2
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics with enabled LoadingPredictor. If the page is prerendered, the recorded value is modified as activation origined.

suffix.name: Preconnectable
suffix.label: The predictor database contained origins for preconnecting for a page

histogram_suffixes.name: PageLoadMetricsClientsMedia
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed in favor of Clients.MediaPageLoad2, which includes samples from prerendered pages.

suffix.name: Clients.MediaPageLoad
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads that involved playing a media element.

suffix.name: Clients.MediaPageLoad2
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads that involved playing a media element. Includes samples from prerendered pages

suffix.name: Clients.MultiTabLoading
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads that started while there are other loading tabs.

suffix.name: Clients.MultiTabLoading.2OrMore
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads that started while there are 2 or more other loading tabs.

suffix.name: Clients.MultiTabLoading.5OrMore
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads that started while there are 5 or more other loading tabs.

suffix.name: Clients.NoScriptPreview
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation that tirggered the NoScript Preview intervention.

suffix.name: Clients.Protocol.H2
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation to main resource over HTTP/2

suffix.name: Clients.Protocol.H11
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation to main resource over HTTP/1.1

suffix.name: Clients.Protocol.QUIC
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation to main resource over QUIC

suffix.name: Clients.ResourceLoadingHintsPreview
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation that used ResourceLoadingHints to show a Preview version of the page.

suffix.name: Clients.Scheme.HTTP
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation to a main resource where the committed URL is HTTP.

suffix.name: Clients.Scheme.HTTPS
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation to a main resource where the committed URL is HTTPS.

suffix.name: Clients.NoServiceWorker2
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics from a page that is either not controlled by a service worker or is controlled by a service worker without a fetch event handler. This should NOT be compared to Clients.ServiceWorker2, see https://goo.gl/EdaGQn.

suffix.name: Clients.ServiceWorker2
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics from a page that is controlled by a service worker that has a fetch event handler.

suffix.name: docs
suffix.label: Custom histogram for the Google Docs page

suffix.name: search
suffix.label: Custom histogram for the Google Search results page

suffix.name: Clients.TabRestore
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics that are a result of a navigation caused by a tab restore.

suffix.name: Clients.EarlyHints.Preload
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics from a page that received preload Link headers via Early Hints responses. Recorded only for main frames.

suffix.name: Clients.EarlyHints2.Preload
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics from a page that received preload Link headers via Early Hints responses. Recorded only for main frames. Includes samples from prerendered pages. record duration from activation start to first contentful paint for prerendered pages. PageLoad.Clients.EarlyHints.Preload.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint and PageLoad.Clients.EarlyHints.Preload.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentfulPaint2 record activation start origined values for prerendered pages.

suffix.name: LoadType.NewNavigation
suffix.label: Restricted to new navigations (link clicks, URLs typed into the URL box, etc).

suffix.name: NoCommit
suffix.label: Limited to page loads that did not commit.

suffix.name: NoEndTime
suffix.label: The page load had no recorded end time, so an end time was synthesized at the time the page end notification was processed.

suffix.name: WithoutPaint
suffix.label: The foreground duration for page loads did not reach first paint.

suffix.name: WithPaint
suffix.label: The foreground duration for page loads reached first paint.

suffix.name: Clients.SignedExchange
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads for which the document was served through a signed exchange.

suffix.name: Clients.SignedExchange.AltSubSXG
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads for which the document was served with prefetched alternative subresource signed exchange.

suffix.name: Clients.SignedExchange.Cached
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads for which the document was served through a cached signed exchange.

suffix.name: Clients.SignedExchange.NotCached
suffix.label: PageLoadMetrics for page loads for which the document was served through a signed exchange directly from network.

suffix.name: UserGesture
suffix.label: Restricted to pages loaded via a user gesture.

suffix.name: UserInitiated
suffix.label: (experimental) Page load metric that is approximately user initiated

suffix.name: BrowserInitiated
suffix.label: (experimental) Page load that was initiated from the browser process

suffix.name: UserGesture
suffix.label: (experimental) Page load that has a user gesture

suffix.name: HistoryLoad
suffix.label: but only for user pressing back or forward

suffix.name: LinkLoad
suffix.label: deprecated - see LinkLoadReload, LinkLoadNormal, LinkLoadStaleOk, LinkLoadCacheOnly; content initiated, commonly back to a posted page

suffix.name: LinkLoadCacheOnly
suffix.label: content initiated, commonly back to a posted page, where browser must ONLY use cache

suffix.name: LinkLoadNormal
suffix.label: content initiated, ordinary link traversal or post

suffix.name: LinkLoadStaleOk
suffix.label: content initiated, commonly forward or back where stale cached data is very acceptable

suffix.name: NormalLoad
suffix.label: but only for user entered URL or omnibox search

suffix.name: Reload
suffix.label: but only for user pressed reload

suffix.name: UndefLoad
suffix.label: should never happen... as it is only for an client-code error case which should not exist

suffix.name: HistoryLoad
suffix.label: but only for user pressing back or forward

suffix.name: LinkLoad
suffix.label: deprecated - see LinkLoadReload, LinkLoadNormal, LinkLoadStaleOk, LinkLoadCacheOnly; content initiated, commonly back to a posted page

suffix.name: LinkLoadCacheOnly
suffix.label: content initiated, commonly back to a posted page, where browser must ONLY use cache

suffix.name: LinkLoadNormal
suffix.label: content initiated, ordinary link traversal or post

suffix.name: LinkLoadStaleOk
suffix.label: content initiated, commonly forward or back where stale cached data is very acceptable

suffix.name: NormalLoad
suffix.label: but only for user entered URL or omnibox search

suffix.name: Reload
suffix.label: but only for user pressed reload

suffix.name: UndefLoad
suffix.label: should never happen... as it is only for an client-code error case which should not exist

suffix.name: ParallelizableDownload
suffix.label: Download that supports but doesn't use parallel requests.

suffix.name: NotUsingAccountStorage
suffix.label: The user is not using the account-scoped password storage. Either they're not signed in, or they haven't opted in to the account storage.

suffix.name: Syncing
suffix.label: The user has enabled Sync, so the account-scoped password storage is not being used.

suffix.name: UsingAccountStorage
suffix.label: The user is signed in and has opted in to the account storage.

suffix.name: SignedInAccountStoreUser
suffix.label: Signed-in user, opted in to the account storage, and saving passwords to the account storage.

suffix.name: SignedInAccountStoreUserSavingLocally
suffix.label: Signed-in user and opted in to the account storage, but has chosen to save passwords only on the device.

suffix.name: SignedInUser
suffix.label: Signed-in user, not opted in to the account storage (but will save passwords to the account storage by default).

suffix.name: SignedInUserSavingLocally
suffix.label: Signed-in user, not opted in to the account storage, and has explicitly chosen to save passwords only on the device.

suffix.name: SignedOutAccountStoreUser
suffix.label: Signed-out user, but an account storage opt-in exists.

suffix.name: SignedOutUser
suffix.label: Signed-out user (and no account storage opt-in exists).

suffix.name: AnyPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password that matches either/both the sync password, signed-in non-syncing password, or a saved password. This is a superset of (and should be equal to or larger than) SyncPasswordEntry + SavedPasswordEntry + NonSyncPasswordEntry

suffix.name: GmailNonSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a non-syncing gaia password that is associated with a Gmail account. This is a subset of NonSyncPasswordEntry.

suffix.name: GmailSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering the sync password that is associated with a Gmail account. This is a subset of SyncPasswordEntry.

suffix.name: GSuiteNonSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a non-syncing gaia password that is associated with a GSuite account. This is a subset of NonSyncPasswordEntry. Note that GSuite non-sync password reuse detection is only triggered if configured appropriate enterprise policy.

suffix.name: GSuiteSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering the sync password that is associated with a GSuite account. This is a subset of SyncPasswordEntry. Note that GSuite sync password reuse detection is only triggered if configured appropriate enterprise policy.

suffix.name: NonGaiaEnterprisePasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password that matches a non-Gaia enterprise password. Note that non-Gaia enterprise password reuse detection is only triggered if configured appropriate enterprise policy.

suffix.name: NonSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering an unconsented primary account password.

suffix.name: PasswordFieldOnFocus
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by password field on focus event.

suffix.name: SavedPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password saved in the password manager where the account is not signed-in to Google.

suffix.name: SyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering the sync password, which may or may not also match a saved password. (This was called SyncProtectedPasswordEntry before M62)

suffix.name: UnknownNonPrimaryPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password that does not match a primary account password but no current signed-in account is found.

suffix.name: UnknownPrimaryPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password that matches a primary account password but no current signed-in account is found.

suffix.name: LowReputation
suffix.label: Password protection reponse with low reputation verdict

suffix.name: Phishing
suffix.label: Password protection response with phishing verdict

suffix.name: Safe
suffix.label: Password protection response with safe verdict

suffix.name: FromHttpRealm
suffix.label: The account in question was saved on an HTTP site.

suffix.name: FromHttpsRealm
suffix.label: The account in question was saved on a HTTPS site (including those with certificate issues).

suffix.name: OnAnyRealmWithDifferentHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have different hosts than the account in question, and their scheme is either HTTP or HTTPS.

suffix.name: OnHttpRealmWithDifferentHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have HTTP scheme and different hosts than the account in question.

suffix.name: OnHttpRealmWithSameHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have HTTP scheme and the same host as the account in question.

suffix.name: OnHttpsRealmWithDifferentHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have HTTPS scheme and different hosts than the account in question.

suffix.name: OnHttpsRealmWithSameHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have HTTPS scheme and the same host as the account in question.

suffix.name: OnPSLMatchingRealm
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms are public suffix matches to that of the account in question (the scheme is always the same in these cases).

suffix.name: InsecureOrigin
suffix.label: The recording took place on an insecure origin.

suffix.name: MixedForm
suffix.label: The recording took place on a secure origin, but the form action was an insecure origin.

suffix.name: SecureOrigin
suffix.label: The recording took place on a secure origin.

suffix.name: LaunchFromDiagnostics
suffix.label: when the user launches the ListUrlActivity from the Physical Web diagnostics page

suffix.name: LaunchFromPreferences
suffix.label: when the user launches the ListUrlActivity from the Physical Web preferencs screen

suffix.name: infoCached
suffix.label: size of file-backed memory minus swap and buffer cache.

suffix.name: infoMemFree
suffix.label: Free memory. Logged from ChromeOS; previously logged from Chromecast from M53 through M97.

suffix.name: ProcessDataTotal
suffix.label: Size of process data (active + inactive + swap).

suffix.name: OnIPAddressChanged
suffix.label: When IP address change is detected

suffix.name: OnMigrateBackToDefaultNetwork
suffix.label: When connection attempts to migrate back to the default network

suffix.name: OnNetworkConnected
suffix.label: When a new network is connected

suffix.name: OnNetworkDisconnected
suffix.label: When an exisiting network is disconnected

suffix.name: OnNetworkMadeDefault
suffix.label: When a network is made as new default

suffix.name: OnNetworkSoonToDisconnect
suffix.label: When an existing network is soon to be disconnected

suffix.name: BigLittle.Big.Browser
suffix.label: Browser processes on big cores of a BIG.little CPU

suffix.name: BigLittle.Big.GPU
suffix.label: GPU processes on big cores of a BIG.little CPU

suffix.name: BigLittle.Big.Other
suffix.label: Other processes on big cores of a BIG.little CPU

suffix.name: BigLittle.Big.Renderer
suffix.label: Renderer processes on big cores of a BIG.little CPU

suffix.name: BigLittle.Little.Browser
suffix.label: Browser processes on little cores of a BIG.little CPU

suffix.name: BigLittle.Little.GPU
suffix.label: GPU processes on little cores of a BIG.little CPU

suffix.name: BigLittle.Little.Other
suffix.label: Other processes on little cores of a BIG.little CPU

suffix.name: BigLittle.Little.Renderer
suffix.label: Renderer processes on little cores of a BIG.little CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Big.Browser
suffix.label: Browser processes on big cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Big.GPU
suffix.label: GPU processes on big cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Big.Other
suffix.label: Other processes on big cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Big.Renderer
suffix.label: Renderer processes on big cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Bigger.Browser
suffix.label: Browser processes on bigger cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Bigger.GPU
suffix.label: GPU processes on bigger cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Bigger.Other
suffix.label: Other processes on bigger cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Bigger.Renderer
suffix.label: Renderer processes on bigger cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Little.Browser
suffix.label: Browser processes on little cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Little.GPU
suffix.label: GPU processes on little cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Little.Other
suffix.label: Other processes on little cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: BigLittleBigger.Little.Renderer
suffix.label: Renderer processes on little cores of a big-little-bigger CPU

suffix.name: Other.Browser
suffix.label: Browser processes on other CPU architectures

suffix.name: Other.GPU
suffix.label: GPU processes on other CPU architectures

suffix.name: Other.Other
suffix.label: Other processes on other CPU architectures

suffix.name: Other.Renderer
suffix.label: Renderer processes on other CPU architectures

suffix.name: Symmetric.Browser
suffix.label: Browser processes on CPUs with symmetric cores

suffix.name: Symmetric.GPU
suffix.label: GPU processes on CPUs with symmetric cores

suffix.name: Symmetric.Other
suffix.label: Other processes on CPUs with symmetric cores

suffix.name: Symmetric.Renderer
suffix.label: Renderer processes on CPUs with symmetric cores

suffix.name: Unknown.Browser
suffix.label: Browser processes on unexpected cores (of any architecture)

suffix.name: Unknown.GPU
suffix.label: GPU processes on unexpected cores (of any architecture)

suffix.name: Unknown.Other
suffix.label: Other processes on unexpected cores (of any architecture)

suffix.name: Unknown.Renderer
suffix.label: Renderer processes on unexpected cores (of any architecture)

suffix.name: CPU
suffix.label: Instantaneous power used by the CPU.

suffix.name: GPU0
suffix.label: Instantaneous power used by the first dedicated GPU, if any.

suffix.name: GPU1
suffix.label: Instantaneous power used by the second dedicated GPU, if any.

suffix.name: GPUi
suffix.label: Instantaneous power used by the integrated GPU, if any.

suffix.name: Total
suffix.label: Instantaneous power used by the whole system. May be less useful than other power metrics because it includes peripherals like the display backlight.

suffix.name: DuringStartup
suffix.label: Sampled once per second during the first 30 seconds after launch.

suffix.name: Changed
suffix.label: Preference value when changed by the user.

suffix.name: ContentPrefetchPrefetchOn
suffix.label: prefetch is enabled but prerender is disabled.

suffix.name: Cold
suffix.label: Prefetch too old to skip revalidation.

suffix.name: Reference
suffix.label: No prefetch. Warning: do not compare with the load times of prefetched pages (bias).

suffix.name: Visible
suffix.label: Page visible for all of rendering.

suffix.name: none
suffix.label: No origin; in the case of prefetch TTFCP this is when no prefetch was involved.

suffix.name: webcross
suffix.label: Link triggered prerender, rel=prerender, cross domain.

suffix.name: websame
suffix.label: Link triggered prerender, rel=prerender, same domain.

suffix.name: HttpsImageCompression
suffix.label: Page Info opened when https image compression was enabled

suffix.name: BlinkGC.AllocatedObjects
suffix.label: Only counting objects allocated using Blink GC.

suffix.name: BlinkGC.Main.Heap
suffix.label: Only counting memory on Blink GC's main thread heap.

suffix.name: BlinkGC.Main.Heap.AllocatedObjects
suffix.label: Only counting objects allocated in Blink GC's main thread heap.

suffix.name: BlinkGC.Main.Heap.Fragmentation
suffix.label: Fragmentation of Blink GC's main thread heap.

suffix.name: CommandBuffer
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by GL command buffers.

suffix.name: Discardable
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Discardable manager.

suffix.name: ExtensionFunctions
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by ExtensionFunctions.

suffix.name: Extensions.ValueStore
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Extension value store database.

suffix.name: GpuMemory
suffix.label: Only counting memory allocated for the GPU.

suffix.name: IOSurface
suffix.label: Memory used for IOSurfaces, on macOS.

suffix.name: IOSurface.DirtyMemory
suffix.label: Memory used for IOSurfaces, on macOS. Only account for dirty (resident and swapped) memory, which is part of private memory footprint.

suffix.name: JavaHeap
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Java heap in Android.

suffix.name: Malloc
suffix.label: Constrained to malloc allocator. Not accurate on Windows (http://crbug.com/780735#c9, http://crbug.com/665516).

suffix.name: Malloc.AllocatedObjects
suffix.label: Only counting objects allocated using the malloc allocator. The measurement is only accurate on Linux and MacOS.

suffix.name: Malloc.CommittedSize
suffix.label: Committed memory size for malloc(). Recorded only when PartitionAlloc is used as malloc().

suffix.name: Malloc.Fragmentation.After1H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of Partition allocator for processes that have existed for >=1H.

suffix.name: Malloc.Fragmentation.After24H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of Partition allocator for processes older than 1 day.

suffix.name: Malloc.MaxAllocatedSize
suffix.label: Highwatermark for allocated memory for malloc(). Recorded only when PartitionAlloc is used as malloc().

suffix.name: Malloc.MaxCommittedSize
suffix.label: Highwatermark for committed memory for malloc(). Recorded only when PartitionAlloc is used as malloc().

suffix.name: Malloc.Wasted
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted due to fragmentation in PartitionAlloc, in bytes.

suffix.name: Malloc.Wasted.After1H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted due to fragmentation in PartitionAlloc, in bytes, for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: Malloc.Wasted.After24H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted due to fragmentation in PartitionAlloc, in bytes, for renderers older than 1 day.

suffix.name: ManualFillingCache
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by the password manager fallbacks.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Partition allocator.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BRPPoolLargestAvailableReservation
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the BRP pool. Only recorded for 64-bit.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BRPPoolLargestAvailableReservation.After1H
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the BRP pool. Only recorded for 64-bit with process uptime [1,24)H.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BRPPoolLargestAvailableReservation.After24H
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the BRP pool. Only recorded for 64-bit with process uptime 24H+.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BRPPoolUsage
suffix.label: Used super pages in the BRP pool.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BRPPoolUsage.After1H
suffix.label: Used super pages in the BRP pool with process uptime [1,24)H.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BRPPoolUsage.After24H
suffix.label: Used super pages in the BRP pool with process uptime 24H+.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.ConfigurablePoolLargestAvailableReservation
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the configurable pool. Only recorded for 64-bit.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.ConfigurablePoolLargestAvailableReservation.After1H
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the configurable pool. Only recorded for 64-bit with process uptime [1,24)H.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.ConfigurablePoolLargestAvailableReservation.After24H
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the configurable pool. Only recorded for 64-bit with process uptime 24H+.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.ConfigurablePoolUsage
suffix.label: Used super pages in the configurable pool. Only recorded for 64-bit.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.ConfigurablePoolUsage.After1H
suffix.label: Used super pages in the configurable pool. Only recorded for 64-bit with process uptime [1,24)H.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.ConfigurablePoolUsage.After24H
suffix.label: Used super pages in the configurable pool. Only recorded for 64-bit with process uptime 24H+.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.RegularPoolLargestAvailableReservation
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the regular pool. Only recorded for 64-bit.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.RegularPoolLargestAvailableReservation.After1H
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the regular pool. Only recorded for 64-bit with process uptime [1,24)H.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.RegularPoolLargestAvailableReservation.After24H
suffix.label: Longest free chunk in the regular pool. Only recorded for 64-bit with process uptime 24H+.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.RegularPoolUsage
suffix.label: Used super pages in the regular pool.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.RegularPoolUsage.After1H
suffix.label: Used super pages in the regular pool. Only recorded when process uptime is [1,24)H.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.RegularPoolUsage.After24H
suffix.label: Used super pages in the regular pool. Only recorded when process uptime is 24H+.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AllocatedObjects
suffix.label: Only counting objects allocated using Partition allocator.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.CommittedSize.ArrayBuffer
suffix.label: Committed memory size for the ArrayBuffer partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.CommittedSize.Buffer
suffix.label: Committed memory size for the Buffer partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.CommittedSize.FastMalloc
suffix.label: Committed memory size for the FastMalloc partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.CommittedSize.Layout
suffix.label: Committed memory size for the Layout partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Fragmentation.ArrayBuffer.After1H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of ArrayBuffer partition. Only recorded for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Fragmentation.ArrayBuffer.After24H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of ArrayBuffer partition. Only recorded for renderers older than 24 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Fragmentation.Buffer.After1H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of Buffer partition. Only recorded for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Fragmentation.Buffer.After24H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of Buffer partition. Only recorded for renderers older than 24 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Fragmentation.FastMalloc.After1H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of FastMalloc partition. Only recorded for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Fragmentation.FastMalloc.After24H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of FastMalloc partition. Only recorded for renderers older than 24 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Fragmentation.Layout.After1H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of Layout partition. Only recorded for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Fragmentation.Layout.After24H
suffix.label: Fragmentation of Layout partition. Only recorded for renderers older than 24 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.MaxAllocatedSize.ArrayBuffer
suffix.label: Highwatermark for allocated memory for the ArrayBuffer partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.MaxAllocatedSize.Buffer
suffix.label: Highwatermark for allocated memory for the Buffer partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.MaxAllocatedSize.FastMalloc
suffix.label: Highwatermark for allocated memory for the FastMalloc partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.MaxAllocatedSize.Layout
suffix.label: Highwatermark for allocated memory for the Layout partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.MaxCommittedSize.ArrayBuffer
suffix.label: Highwatermark for committed memory for the ArrayBuffer partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.MaxCommittedSize.Buffer
suffix.label: Highwatermark for committed memory for the Buffer partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.MaxCommittedSize.FastMalloc
suffix.label: Highwatermark for committed memory for the FastMalloc partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.MaxCommittedSize.Layout
suffix.label: Highwatermark for committed memory for the Layout partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.ArrayBuffer
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Array Buffer partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.Buffer
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Buffer partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.FastMalloc
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Fast Malloc partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.Layout
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Layout partition.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.ArrayBuffer
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the ArrayBuffer partition due to fragmentation, in bytes.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.ArrayBuffer.After1H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the ArrayBuffer partition due to fragmentation, in bytes. Only recorded for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.ArrayBuffer.After24H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the ArrayBuffer partition due to fragmentation, in bytes. Only recorded for renderers older than 24 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.Buffer
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the Buffer partition due to fragmentation, in bytes.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.Buffer.After1H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the Buffer partition due to fragmentation, in bytes. Only recorded for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.Buffer.After24H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the Buffer partition due to fragmentation, in bytes. Only recorded for renderers older than 24 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.FastMalloc
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the FastMalloc partition due to fragmentation, in bytes.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.FastMalloc.After1H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the FastMalloc partition due to fragmentation, in bytes. Only recorded for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.FastMalloc.After24H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the FastMalloc partition due to fragmentation, in bytes. Only recorded for renderers older than 24 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.Layout
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the Layout partition due to fragmentation, in bytes.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.Layout.After1H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the Layout partition due to fragmentation, in bytes. Only recorded for renderers older than 1 hour.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.Wasted.Layout.After24H
suffix.label: Amount of memory that is wasted in the Layout partition due to fragmentation, in bytes. Only recorded for renderers older than 24 hour.

suffix.name: SharedImages
suffix.label: All SharedImages memory. Typically accounted for in other processes, e.g. renderers, this is the total Chrome-wide memory used by SharedImages.

suffix.name: SiteStorage
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Web storage API.

suffix.name: SiteStorage.BlobStorage
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by in-memory blob files.

suffix.name: Skia
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Skia caches.

suffix.name: Skia.SkGlyphCache

suffix.name: Skia.SkResourceCache

suffix.name: Sync

suffix.name: V8

suffix.name: V8.AllocatedObjects

suffix.name: V8.Main.GlobalHandles

suffix.name: V8.Main.GlobalHandles.AllocatedObjects

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.AllocatedObjects

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.CodeSpace

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.CodeSpace.AllocatedObjects

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.LargeObjectSpace
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by the large-object-space of V8 heap

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.LargeObjectSpace.AllocatedObjects
suffix.label: Only counting objects allocated in the large-object-space of V8 heap

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.MapSpace

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.NewLargeObjectSpace
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by the new-large-object-space of V8 heap

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.NewLargeObjectSpace.AllocatedObjects
suffix.label: Only counting objects allocated in the new-large-object-space of V8 heap

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.NewSpace

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.NewSpace.AllocatedObjects

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.OldSpace
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by the old-space of V8 heap

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.OldSpace.AllocatedObjects
suffix.label: Only counting objects allocated in the old-space of V8 heap

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.ReadOnlySpace
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by the read-only-space of V8 heap

suffix.name: V8.Main.Heap.ReadOnlySpace.AllocatedObjects
suffix.label: Only counting objects allocated in the read-only-space of V8 heap

suffix.name: ServiceDiscardableManager
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by the gpu discardable cache.

suffix.name: ServiceDiscardableManager.AvgImageSize
suffix.label: Only counting the average image size of entries in the gpu discardable cache

suffix.name: ServiceTransferCache
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by images in the gpu transfer cache.

suffix.name: ServiceTransferCache.AvgImageSize
suffix.label: Only counting the average size of image entries in the gpu transfer cache

suffix.name: Discardable.ResidentSize
suffix.label: Amount of resident memory held by ClientDiscardableSharedMemoryManager.

suffix.name: DownloadService
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Download service.

suffix.name: FontCaches
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by font caches.

suffix.name: Gpu.GrShaderCache
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Shader Cache.

suffix.name: History
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by History service.

suffix.name: LevelDatabase
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Level databases.

suffix.name: Malloc.Aligned.ObjectCount
suffix.label: Number of allocated objects. Only counting malloc memory allocated in the partition_alloc aligned partition.

suffix.name: Malloc.Allocator.ObjectCount
suffix.label: Number of allocated objects. Only counting malloc memory allocated in the partition_alloc allocator partition.

suffix.name: Malloc.BRPQuarantined
suffix.label: Memory used by objects quarantined by BRP, recorded when USE_BACKUP_REF_PTR build flag is enabled.

suffix.name: Malloc.BRPQuarantinedBytesPerMinute
suffix.label: Total size of BRP quarantined bytes per minute, averaged during the last memory dump interval.

suffix.name: Malloc.BRPQuarantinedCount
suffix.label: Number of slots quarantined by BRP, recorded when USE_BACKUP_REF_PTR build flag is enabled.

suffix.name: Malloc.Original.ObjectCount
suffix.label: Number of allocated objects. Only counting malloc memory allocated in the partition_alloc original partition.

suffix.name: Malloc.ThreadCache
suffix.label: Memory used by all thread caches, recorded when PartitionAlloc is used as malloc().

suffix.name: Net
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Networking sockets and caches.

suffix.name: Net.UrlRequestContext
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by URL requests and associated http cache.

suffix.name: OmniboxSuggestions
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Omnibox suggestions provider.

suffix.name: ParkableImage.OnDiskSize
suffix.label: Size of encoded image data of ParkableImages that are on disk.

suffix.name: ParkableImage.TotalSize

suffix.name: ParkableImage.UnparkedSize

suffix.name: Sqlite

suffix.name: TabRestore

suffix.name: UI

suffix.name: WebCache

suffix.name: WebCache.CSSStylesheetResources
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by CSS Stylesheet resources in Blink Web Cache.

suffix.name: WebCache.EncodedSizeDuplicatedInDataUrls
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by data URLs of Image resources in Blink Web Cache.

suffix.name: WebCache.FontResources
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Font resources in Blink Web Cache.

suffix.name: WebCache.ImageResources
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by Image resources in Blink Web Cache.

suffix.label: Only counting memory used by other resources in Blink Web Cache.

suffix.name: WebCache.ScriptResources

suffix.name: WebCache.XSLStylesheetResources
suffix.label: Only counting memory used by XSL Stylesheet resources in Blink Web Cache.

suffix.name: Malloc.BRPQuarantinedCountPerMinute

suffix.name: Malloc.SyscallsPerMinute
suffix.label: Number of system calls made per minute, averaged during the last memory dump interval. Only collected when PartitionAlloc is malloc().

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BlocklistHitCount

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BlocklistHitCount.After1H
suffix.label: Monotonically increasing count of failures in finding a non-blocklisted address. Only recorded for 32-bit with process uptime [1,24)H.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BlocklistHitCount.After24H
suffix.label: Monotonically increasing count of failures in finding a non-blocklisted address. Only recorded for 32-bit with process uptime 24H+.

suffix.label: Monotonically increasing count of blocked addresses. Only recorded for 32-bit.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BlocklistSize.After1H
suffix.label: Monotonically increasing count of blocked addresses. Only recorded for 32-bit with process uptime [1,24)H.

suffix.name: PartitionAlloc.AddressSpace.BlocklistSize.After24H
suffix.label: Monotonically increasing count of blocked addresses. Only recorded for 32-bit with process uptime 24H+.

suffix.name: GAIAAddSession

suffix.name: GAIASignup
suffix.label: GAIA-initiated interaction indicating a service type of Add an account

suffix.name: NonGAIA
